author: Rachel Okporu Fadoju
title: El-Rufai’s Son Reacts As Muslim Cleric Who Called For Killing Of Tinubu’s Wife Apologizes
text:
Nigeria News
El-Rufai’s Son Reacts As Muslim Cleric Who Called For Killing Of Tinubu’s Wife Apologizes
The lawmaker representing Kaduna North Federal Constituency in the House of Representatives, Mohammed Bello El-Rufai, has reacted after the Islamic cleric who said the First Lady,
Oluremi Tinubu, deserves to die for being a pastor apologized for his statement.
Naija News reported that in the audio,
the cleric could be heard stating that Remi Tinubu must be killed because she is the leader of infidels in the country.
He insisted that she deserves to die for being a pastor.
He also said that the Muslim/Muslim ticket that brought President Bola Tinubu to power was a scam.
Responding to X user, who said that the cleric had apologised over the statement, Bello stated the cleric should keep his apology to himself.
The son of the immediate past governor of Kaduna state, Nasir El-Rufai, in a now-deleted tweet, said security agencies should immediately arrest and prosecute the cleric.
He wrote: “He should keep his apology. They should arrest him and prosecute him immediately.”
Meanwhile, a former senator,
Shehu Sani, has insisted that the cleric’s statement was unacceptable and condemnable.
He noted that it was within the democratic rights of a citizen to criticise government policies, but calling for the murder of the first lady was preposterous.
According to him, “Criticising the Government and its policies is within the ambit of democratic rights;but Calling for the killing of Senator Remi Tinubu by the religious cleric is unacceptable and utterly condemnable.”

author: 网易
title: 足球报："专治不服"的河南队回来了，这是河南球迷久违的球队|中超|申花|点球大战|塞尔希奥·拉莫斯·加西亚_网易订阅
text:
直播吧7月24日讯 足协杯1/4决赛，河南队客场点球大战淘汰上海申花晋级，《足球》报撰文谈到河南队表现时认为，“专治不服”的河南队回来了。
《足球》报表示，当徐嘉敏扑出刘诚宇点球的那一刻，河南队替补席“疯了”，留守在郑州的俱乐部工作人员哭了。很多人甚至没有想到河南队能将中超领头羊逼入如此绝境，更别说笑到最后。对河南球迷而言，这个夜晚太美妙，不仅有惊险刺激的比赛过程，还代表着拉莫斯接手球队后的阶段性成果，更重要的是——专治不服的中原足球精神回来了。
整场比赛，河南队展现的团队意识、对比赛的高专注度，包括不畏强敌的中原足球精神是最令人动容的。全队很好维持了战术框架，几次三番面对困境都能咬牙撑到最后。对阵申花，卡多索活跃至极，梅开二度并制造多次威胁的他，再次成为河南队晋级的功臣，全场5次射门4次射正，效率惊人。
点球大战的剧情走势同样如此，卡多索第一个主罚就被薛庆浩扑出，但后续出场的球员都顶住了压力。黄紫昌失点让球队第二次落后，但徐嘉敏始终站在他们身后，为球队力挽狂澜。替补门将徐嘉敏不仅在120分钟里多次做出关键扑救，更是在压力巨大的点球大战中三度扑出对手的点球，直接决定了比赛走向。
可以说，这是一支河南球迷“久违”的球队，尤其在过去一段时间内，“习惯性被逆转”甚至成为球队不得不背负的尴尬标签。但拉莫斯执教之后，球队从气质上有了很大的改观，也许是因为太久没有这样的刺激了，不少工作人员都红了眼眶。
河南队用实际行动证明，在中超赛场实力差距并非不可逾越，只要战术得当、斗志顽强，任何球队都能创造奇迹。这场比赛不仅让河南球迷热血沸腾，也为中国足球提供了一个以弱胜强、永不言弃的经典案例。

author: @eleconomista
title: Pemex reporta dos fugas en oleoducto que llega a la terminal marítima de Dos Bocas
text:
Empresas
Lectura 1:00 min
Pemex reporta dos fugas en oleoducto que llega a la terminal marítima de Dos Bocas
La petrolera estatal señaló que se estaban realizando los preparativos para verificar la estanqueidad del oleoducto y reanudar su funcionamiento.
Petróleos Mexicanos (Pemex) informó el miércoles por la noche de que había subsanado dos fugas en un oleoducto que transporta petróleo desde su plataforma Akal-C hasta la terminal marítima de Dos Bocas, en el sureño estado de Tabasco.
En un comunicado, Pemex señaló que se estaban realizando los preparativos para verificar la estanqueidad del oleoducto y reanudar su funcionamiento.
Te puede interesar
El anuncio se produce después de que medios locales informaran el miércoles de una fuga de petróleo en el golfo de México.
Pemex dijo que el petróleo había alcanzado un tramo de siete kilómetros (4.35 millas) de la costa en la Terminal Marítima de Dos Bocas en el municipio de Paraíso, Tabasco. El comunicado de la empresa añadía que se esperaba que la limpieza finalizara en las próximas horas y que estaba trabajando con las comunidades locales para ayudarles a reanudar la pesca.
El anuncio de Pemex se produce una semana después de que un incidente paralizara temporalmente las operaciones en la refinería Olmeca de la empresa, adyacente a la terminal de Dos Bocas.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->energy and resource

author: Evan Casey
title: Vacant Lots Becoming Public Healing Spaces
text: Vacant Lots Becoming Public Healing Spaces City of Milwaukee program has found broad support from neighbors. For years, [Rosalind Cox](https://urbanmilwaukee.com/people/rosalind-cox) would watch as people used a vacant lot on Milwaukee’s north side to gather before going into a nearby liquor store. But after partnering with the city through its “Healing Spaces Initiative,” that city-owned lot was transformed into a space with plants, benches, stones and paths. People now gather there to read, walk and talk with others. “It is a healing space and I would say there has been healing going on with the community,” Cox said about the space. Milwaukee has over 3,200 vacant city-owned lots. Starting in 2021, the city launched the new initiative, largely in response to the isolation many were feeling from the COVID-19 pandemic. “We thought this would be a great opportunity to bring people back outside, bring them back together and to utilize some of our vacant lot spaces,” said [Angela Mitchell](https://urbanmilwaukee.com/people/angela-mitchell) Reid, the community outreach liaison for the program. Mitchell Reid said the goal is to bring relaxing and natural environments to city-owned vacant lots for residents to enjoy. Part of the plan is also to eliminate blighted spaces and to activate those spaces for new uses. There are currently 14 healing spaces across the city, most of them on the city’s north side and many run by churches, neighborhood groups or community organizations. “We’re trying to get as many as we can in different spots across the city,” Mitchell Reid said. Her hope is for the spaces, which vary in size and design, to be used for town hall meetings, yoga sessions, healthy eating workshops, therapy opportunities and other events; all at no cost to residents. Most of them look like a pocket park, with benches, lighting, gardens and plants. Some of them even have bird houses, little free libraries and even chess tables for people to use. “It’s a way to engage the public and to utilize our vacant spaces,” Mitchell Reid said. “We want people, if they’re utilizing these spaces, to feel calm and relaxed.” When the city first started the initiative, Mitchell Reid said she heard from residents that they felt valued and appreciated. “We have a lot of vacant lots and while we don’t have the opportunity to create green spaces on all of them, the ones we have had a chance to utilize have been very important to the residents,” she said. To apply for a space, residents or community organizations must live in the neighborhood where the lot is located. The city’s department of public works manages basic upkeep, like clearing snow, mowing the lawn and removing litter. But community partners maintain the other amenities. “Every vacant lot has a story behind it and if we can make it a positive one by installing green spaces or adding a healing space to these vacant lots, I think that’s an important aspect of lot development and also engagement with the community,” Mitchell Reid said. Two more healing spaces are set to open in 2024. Cox said the healing space she partners with, near [Washington Park](https://urbanmilwaukee.com/place/washington-park-2), will soon be used as a small music venue. She also wants it to be a space for teaching and for children to play. “People like to be entertained, and they love to do entertaining, and you don’t see that a lot unless you go to some of these festivals and some of the festivals are like miles and miles and miles away,” Cox said. “When you got something right here in the community, you can go right down the street and do this.” Cox said she has big plans for the space in the coming years. “I would hope that it would build up the community even more … where other people would come out and enjoy the area, having different kind of not just meetings out there, but gatherings,” Cox said. “All those things that involve health, mental health, physical health.” To learn more about how to apply to start a new healing space, you can visit the [city’s website](https://city.milwaukee.gov/DCD/NIDC/Healing-Spaces-Initiative). Editor’s note: For more on Milwaukee’s healing spaces, [see Urban Milwaukee’s coverage from July](https://urbanmilwaukee.com/2023/07/03/new-healing-spaces-created-in-vacant-lots/). Listen to the WPR report [here](https://www.wpr.org/listen/2128174) [Milwaukee is transforming vacant city-owned lots into ‘healing spaces’ with gardens, little free libraries](https://www.wpr.org/milwaukee-transforming-vacant-lots-healing-spaces-gardens-little-libraries) was originally published by Wisconsin Public Radio. If you think stories like this are important, become a member of Urban Milwaukee and help support real, independent journalism. Plus you get [some cool added benefits](https://urbanmilwaukee.com/membership-account/membership-levels/). [Wisconsin Public Radio](https://urbanmilwaukee.com/category/source/wisconsin-public-radio/)

organizations.name: public healing spaces vacant lots becoming public healing spaces city of milwaukee

author: Axel Leclercq
title: 6 arbres d'intérieur à faire pousser chez soi pour embellir sa maison
text: Pour avoir un arbre, on n’est pas obligé d’avoir un jardin. Certains arbres s’adaptent très bien à nos intérieurs et peuvent parfaitement pousser et s’épanouir dans un pot. Pour vous donner quelques idées, voici six exemples d’arbres d’intérieur à installer dans sa maison. Le pachira Avec son tronc tressé et ses feuilles en étoile, le pachira présente un look qui sort de l’ordinaire. Veillez à ce qu’il ne manque pas de lumière (sans l’exposer directement aux rayons du soleil), arrosez-le régulièrement et il devrait se porter comme un charme dans votre maison. Le schefflera Décrit par [20 Minutes](https://maison.20minutes.fr/mm42020-plus-beau-arbres-interieur/) comme “un arbre facile à entretenir”, le schefflera arboricola “est une valeur sûre pour décorer votre intérieur. On aime particulièrement ses feuilles palmées érigées en haut de son tronc. Nul doute qu’il fera sensation dans votre intérieur.” L’arbre de jade Il existe plusieurs variétés d’arbre de jade. Avec des formes de feuilles différentes. L’arbre de jade “demande à être installé dans un sol léger et drainant et dans un emplacement lumineux. Aux beaux jours, vous pouvez l’installer à l’extérieur, mais il faudra le rentrer le soir s’il y a le moindre risque de gelée.” Le polyscias Le polyscias peut mesurer jusqu’à 1M60 de haut. Il doit être exposé de façon indirecte au soleil et dans une pièce où la température dépasse 16 degrés. Pensez à l’arroser régulièrement. Le calamondin Croisement entre le kumquat et le mandarinier, le calamondin, précise Le Figaro, a “besoin d’une exposition non directe à la lumière naturelle et d’être à l’abri des courants d’air. Il fera ainsi des fleurs blanches parfumées et des fruits ressemblant à de petites oranges, ce qui lui vaut le surnom d’«oranger d’appartement ».” Le citronnier Pour avoir un beau citronnier dans votre maison, Le Figaro vous recommande de “l’installer dans un endroit ensoleillé – idéalement orienté plein sud ou sud-est – et loin des courants d’air. Vous pouvez prendre soin de lui avec un terreau adapté aux agrumes et en l’arrosant régulièrement mais sans excès.”
